info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 06 at 11:55PM CDT until July 07 at 12:30AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM MDT FOR NORTHWESTERN WALLACE AND SOUTH CENTRAL SHERMAN COUNTIES... At 1055 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 15 miles northwest of Sharon Springs, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Wallace and south central Sherman Counties. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM MDT for northwestern and west central Kansas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
